data.description:
◆Adventure with the Cute Anime Girl.
Portal meets Shadow of the Colossus in this memorable and intimate title.

◆A Tale Tailored to VR
Experience communication with a virtual character in a VR title developed as "an adventure game for the VR age."

◆Unique VR Puzzles
Work with Haru to deactivate the large, puzzle-like barriers blocking your path. Teamwork is key, as some objects can only be used by one of you!

◆Intense Battles With Kami
Together, you will discover how to quell each of the giant "Kami."

Save the world with Haru, a shrine maiden who quells "Kami!"

Haru has summoned you to Onogoro Island, a floating island in a parallel world. Together, you must solve sprawling puzzles and defeat giant beasts called "Kami" that are blocking your path.

A grand adventure depicting the bond between you and Haru awaits in this uniquely Japanese VR action adventure!

Save them. They are in your hands.

changelog.change_log:
- Improved the anti-aliasing level.
- Improved the shadow quality.
- Increased the rendering distance of objects.
- Enhanced the haptic feedback experience with the new Meta Quest Touch Plus Controllers.
- Other minor adjustments.

- Compatibility support for Meta Quest Pro.
- Allowed to adjust the Comfort Vignette in 4 strength levels (Inactive, Small, Medium, Large).
- Increased the healing speed in "Shield" Mode.
- Added Simplified Chinese UI interface and subtitles.
- Other minor adjustments.

- Added a Blink ON/OFF option for snap turns
- Fixed an issue where Channelling stones became unable to return to their active state if their ki had been absorbed under certain conditions.
- Enabled "Skip Event" within the Options Menu, even when holding hands with Haru.
- Adjusted so that in the event Haru jumps on/off the Quelling Stone due to the proximity of objects like Lodestones, she will not automatically reactive a Sakafune Stone that has already been activated once.
- Other minor adjustments.

- Added a "Shield" Mode (Easy Difficulty) option in game.
- Added a feature to skip events by long-pressing the trigger button.
- Added an option to adjust the strength of the haptic feedback of the controllers.
- Other minor adjustments.

- Adjustments in the handling of Haru's action during healing to make her face the player more often.
- Fixed progression issue when the gate of the divine boundary is opened while Haru is dragging away by Masatake's black arts of the Path of the Demon.
- Fixed progression issue that affected Chapter 4 Map 5 and Chapter 6 Map 5 under particular conditions while Hime is hit.
- Fixed progression issue that affected Chapter 5 Map 2, where Haru sometimes became unable to dismount the quelling stone at goal stage.
- Overall lighting adjustments.
- Other minor adjustments.

- Fixed issue where the achievement "The One Who Controls Fate" was not unlocked in some situations despite fulfilling the achievement requirements, such as when the game was uninstalled and reinstalled or when the game was played on multiple Meta Quest devices. 
- Fixed issue where, in some situations, the achievement "The One Who Travels Another Path" was unlocked during the first playthrough instead of the achievement "The One Who Travels." 
- Fixed progression issue that affected Chapter 4 Map 5 and Chapter 6 Map 5, where Haru sometimes became unable to dismount the quelling stone if the player had placed Haru on the ground in the same area as the boss and then restarted the map in that state.
- Other minor adjustments
